title: Basic Instruction Writing
description: Learn to write clear, single-task instructions for AI systems

learningObjective.primary: Master the fundamentals of writing clear, unambiguous instructions
subObjectives: Understand the importance of explicit task definition

clarity.description: How clear and unambiguous is the instruction

criteria.name: Task Definition
criteria.description: Task is explicitly stated in the first sentence

criteria.name: Language Clarity
criteria.description: Uses simple, direct language without ambiguous pronouns

criteria.name: Single Focus
criteria.description: Maintains focus on one clear task or objective

criteria.name: Logical Flow
criteria.description: Information is presented in a logical sequence

specificity.description: How specific and detailed are the requirements

criteria.name: Output Format
criteria.description: Clearly specifies the desired output format

criteria.name: Parameters
criteria.description: Defines any necessary parameters or constraints

criteria.name: Context
criteria.description: Provides relevant context needed for the task

criteria.name: Success Criteria
criteria.description: Indicates how to determine if the output is successful

conciseness.description: How efficiently the instruction is communicated

criteria.name: Word Economy
criteria.description: Uses minimal necessary words to convey instruction

sampleCorrectPrompts.prompt: Summarize the main points of this article in 3-5 bullet points, with each point being 1-2 sentences long.

strengths: Sets length constraints (1-2 sentences per point)
analysis.explanation: This prompt succeeds because it provides clear, specific instructions about both the task and the desired output format while remaining concise.

sampleCorrectPrompts.prompt: Create a step-by-step guide for making coffee using a French press. Include exactly 6 steps, with each step being one clear action.

strengths: Sets content constraint (one action per step)
analysis.explanation: This prompt effectively combines clarity and specificity while maintaining a single focus and providing clear structural requirements.

commonMistakes.problem: No clear definition of 'better' or what aspect needs improvement
commonMistakes.improvement: Revise this text to improve clarity by using shorter sentences and simpler vocabulary.

commonMistakes.example: I want you to analyze this, then summarize it, then create an outline, and also maybe add some examples if you can.
commonMistakes.problem: Multiple competing tasks with unclear priorities and optional elements
commonMistakes.improvement: Analyze this text and create a bulleted summary of the main arguments, limited to 5 key points.

tips: Start with the main task verb (Create, Write, Analyze, etc.)
Include any crucial constraints or limitations
